Sets the maximum size of the window. If these are set to 0, default values specified by the window manager are used.

int CWindow::setNotifyFlags ( int flags,
int mask = 0xFFFFFF )
 

int CWindow::getNotifyFlags ( )
 

Controls which events the Window Manager tells the application about. flags are asssembled by an binary or (|) of Ph_WM_BACKDROP allows the window to be the workspace backdrop Ph_WM_CLOSE closes the application Ph_WM_CONSWITCH moves the window to keep it on the visible display whenever the virtual Photon console is switched Ph_WM_FFRONT allow the window to become force front Ph_WM_FOCUS handles gaining and losing focus for this window Ph_WM_HELP provides context-sensitive help Ph_WM_ICON iconifies the window Ph_WM_MAX maximizes the window Ph_WM_MENU pops up the window menu Ph_WM_MOVE moves the window Ph_WM_RESIZE resizes the application Ph_WM_RESTORE restores the window after it has been iconified, maximized, or hidden Ph_WM_TOBACK sends the window to the back Ph_WM_TOFRONT sends the window to the front Ph_WM_HIDE hides the window

int CWindow::setManagedFlags ( int flags,
int mask = 0xFFFFFF )
 

int CWindow::getManagedFlags ( )
 

Controls which actions the Window Manager performs for the application, but doesn't affect whether or not the Window Manager notifies the application of those actions (for that, use setNotifyFlags Flags: See setNotifyFlags

int CWindow::setRenderFlags ( int flags,
int mask = 0xFFFFFF )
 

int CWindow::getRenderFlags ( )
 

Controls how the Window Manager renders components of the window Ph_WM_RENDER_BORDER Put a border around the window. Ph_WM_RENDER_CLOSE If the window has a title bar, include a close button. Ph_WM_RENDER_HELP If the window has a title bar, include a help button. Ph_WM_RENDER_MAX If the window has a title bar, include a maximize button. Ph_WM_RENDER_MIN If the window has a title bar, include a minimize button. Ph_WM_RENDER_MENU If the window has a title bar, include a menu button. Ph_WM_RENDER_RESIZE If the window has a border, add resize handles. Ph_WM_RENDER_TITLE If the window has a border, add a title bar. The default value is Ph_WM_APP_DEF_RENDER, a convenience manifest that combines some of these flags. For more info, see <PhWm.h>.

int CWindow::moveToFront ( )
 

This function brings the window widget to the front of the workspace and gives it focus. To do this, the function sends a message to the Window Manager. The Window Manager may switch consoles if the specified window isn't within the current workspace.

Reimplemented from CWidget.

int CWindow::moveToBack ( )
 

This function moves the window widget to the back of the workspace. To do this, the function sends a message to the Window Manager.

Reimplemented from CWidget.

int CWindow::focus ( )
 

This function lets your application give focus to the window widget. To do this, the function sends a message to the Window Manager, telling it to give the window focus. The Window Manager may change consoles if the specified window isn't in the current console.

int CWindow::doModalDialog ( )
 

Modal processing of a dialog window. Returns with the return code that endModalDialog sets

void CWindow::endModalDialog ( unsigned int returnCode = 1 )
 

Ends the dialog processing by the dialog itself.

void CWindow::centerInParent ( CWidget * parent )
 

Centers the window within a parent

void CWindow::moveToPointer ( int inputGroup )
 

Moves the window such that its upper left corner is at the current pointer position

void CWindow::moveCenterToPointer ( int inputGroup )
 

Moves the window such that its center is at the current pointer position

void CWindow::addWindowEventCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

Adds a callback that the widget invokes when it receives an event from the Window Manager.

void CWindow::addWindowClosingCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

Adds a callback that the widget invokes when the window is being closed. It's invoked before the window's region is removed.

void CWindow::addWindowOpeningCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

Adds a callback that the widget invokes when the window is being opened. If you want to resize the window and want anchoring to be in effect, do it in this type of callback.

void CWindow::addWindowTransportCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

Adds a callback that the widget invokes when the window is being transported through a jump gate.
